physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient appeared well and was well nourished. Notable findings included a reddish-brown, mildly edematous plaque, 2 cm in diameter on the left cheek and approximately 100 reddish-brown, barely palpable papules, 2 to 5 mm, primarily on the chest and abdomen, with some involvement of the lower sacrum and buttocks.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The lesion on the left cheek occasionally became more swollen. The patient experienced regression of skin lesions after treatment, with almost complete resolution within a week, but the rash recurred a month after the treatment.
